subclassFeature.name: Fencer
entries: Fencers are highly skilled duelists and swordmasters. These quick-footed warriors forego the usual heavy armor that most fighters wear, in favor of unfettered movement and flexibility. Fencers have a flair for style and panache, and usually seize victory with a cunningly precise strike that leaves their foes baffled, and shortly thereafter, bleeding.

Some fencers are rumored to be unsavory rakes and scoundrels, while many others are featured in songs and chronicles as heroes with a bold and audacious air. Some of these seedy rumors and heroic retellings might actually refer to the same person!

subclassFeature.name: Well Rounded
entries: Fencers often train in more diverse skill sets than is typical for fighters. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Acrobatics, Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

subclassFeature.name: Precise Flourish
entries: You have incorporated stylistic flair into your fighting style that masks your deadly precision. When you make a melee weapon attack with a finesse weapon wielded in one hand, and have nothing in your off-hand, you may spend a Precision Die, a {@dice d8}, to roll it and add the result to the attack roll. You may also perform a flourish that confounds or hinders the target. You may decide to roll the Precision Die, and declare which flourish you perform, after seeing the result of your attack roll, but you must do so before you know whether the attack hits or misses.

You have a number of Precision Dice equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all spent Precision Dice when you finish a short or long rest. The DC of a flourish’s saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Charisma modifier. You may choose any of the below flourishes:

items: {@b Befuddling Routine.} You incorporate such complex movements in your attack routine that your opponent is left briefly unsure of its next move. The target of your attack must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

{@b Demoralizing Feint.} You use your attack to cleverly disguise a feint that leaves your opponent looking foolishly outmatched. The target of your attack has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn. In addition, add the number you rolled on the Precision Die to the damage roll of your attack.

{@b Disarming Sweep.} The target of your attack must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or drop one item of your choice that it is holding. As a reaction, you may choose to either catch the creature’s dropped item in your off-hand, or fling it up to 15 feet away.

subclassFeature.name: Unfettered Defense
entries: You incorporate your sense of panache into your flexible defensive style. While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 11 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.
Additionally, when you reach 10th level in this class, you gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws while you are wearing no armor nor wielding a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Audacious
entries: Your bold nature and reputation lends you an audacious air. Whenever you roll a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or any Charisma ability check, you may spend a Precision Die to roll it and add its result to your ability check. You may decide to roll the Precision Die after seeing the result of your ability check, but before you know whether it succeeds or fails.

subclassFeature.name: Parry and Retort
entries: When you are wielding a finesse weapon in one hand and have nothing in your off-hand, and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you may spend a Precision Die as a reaction to roll it and add its result to your AC against that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss. If the creature’s attack does miss, you may immediately make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Precision
entries: Your Precision Dice turn into d10s. At 18th level, they turn into d12s.

subclassFeature.name: Dazzling Flourish
entries: Your stylistic flair and precision have only improved as you’ve fought across various battles, refining and improving upon your techniques while devising new ways to trick and befuddle your enemies. You gain access to the following flourishes in addition to the ones you already know:

items: {@b Nimble Strikes.} Your blade becomes a blur of speed, striking at your opponent in a deadly show of skill and grace. You may immediately make another attack against your opponent, rolling your Precision Die and adding the result to the damage roll of the second attack. This attack’s damage does not benefit from your ability modifier, however.

{@b First Blood.} You’ve become adept at striking at your foes with pinpoint accuracy, quickly securing first blood and winning the fight. Though, nothing says this technique isn’t helpful in fights to the death. The target immediately takes damage equal to one roll of your Precision Die, and begins to bleed for 1 minute. At the start of the target’s turn, they take damage equal to one roll of your Precision Die. The target may make a Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. This ability works on creatures even without blood, as you manage to cut deep into whatever the target may be made of.

{@b Pommel Strike.} You strike the enemy with the pommel of your weapon while their guard is down in an attempt to daze and confuse them. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Enduring Precision
entries: When you roll initiative and have no Precision Dice remaining, you regain one Precision Die.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Challenge
entries: Through your trials and endless hours of practice, you’ve finally learned everything you could about the art of dueling. Your name heralded far and wide as one of the deadliest duelists in all the land, and with such fame and skill, you’ve learned a technique only usable by those who have mastered the art of fencing. The Grand Challenge.

As an action, select one creature within 30 feet of you to issue your challenge to. Once you do, you take on the poise and style and grace of the masters who have come before you, knowing exactly where to strike your adversary to end the duel as quickly as you can. Until the end of your next turn, the target’s vital spots are made known to you. Whenever you successfully hit the creature with a melee weapon attack, you deal additional damage equal to one roll of your Precision Die. Once you have successfully hit the target four times before this effect ends, you instill within yourself a burst of speed and confidence as the creature’s death approaches, regaining hit points equal to your fighter level and doubling your movement speed until the end of your turn. After landing the fourth strike, your Grand Challenge comes to an end.
You may use this ability once per short or long rest.
